content.description: This route is not yet listed on Mountain Project, but has clearly been cleaned and climbed recently.   I think it deserves a listing because of it's moderate grade, beautiful setting, and great landing.   If the folks who cleaned it prefer another name, of course I'll change it-- this name is a historical RI reference I thought would fit a historic area.
content.location: Traverse from right to left under the obvious overhang on the clean holds to a top out just past the end of the overhang.

content.description: Climb straight up over roof using a hidden man-made two-finger pocket to an easy mantel.
content.location: Center of Bay View wall, under obvious roof.

content.description: This area is markedly different from the rest of the climbing at Rocky Point. The rock is Puddingstone conglomerate, and much of it still needs to be cleaned and developed.    It's in a beautiful spot with a full view of the water, just up a stairway from the walking path.   There's the potential for several more climbs in the V0-V2.   The landings are great-- just a grassy lawn.
